intro: Secamone alpini, commonly known as the Alpine secamone, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes approximately 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pink flowers that bloom in the summer months. It typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun. Secamone alpini is often found in meadows and on slopes, contributing to the biodiversity of its habitat.
